alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 10:35AM EDT until May 05 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. For the Kennebec River...including AUGUSTA, Bingham Wyman Dam, Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flood parking lots on Front Street in Augusta. At 13.0 feet, Water covering dock at town landing in Hallowell * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:24 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 12.7 feet late tonight. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EDT.
